title: When speaking Japanese, is it rude to say 'ore'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Its not rude, its just being pretentious. It’s used with people you might know well, people you have grown up with, and few foreigners in Japan have friends they went to high school with. If you use “ore” you probably use “omae” (you) which would be being rude as you are using a sense of familiarity you are not entitled to.

It can come off as egotistical or pretentious if you use it when speaking to others who are not your friends or family. It is not appropriate in business settings. Essentially, it tends to carry a nuance of ‘strength’, ‘maturity’, and ‘confidence’, so if the person who uses this term does not have these qualities, it rings false.
